intro: Navarretia gracilis, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies. Navarretia gracilis is also known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local ecosystems.
